page.title: 04THE LOCAL DISCO
page.content: I am 11 years old and once a week on Tuesday evenings I go to a{disco.}A disco is a place where records are played and people can dance. The disco is held at a club called Woody's in Jacksdale. It starts at 7.00pm. and finishes at 9.30pm. Only children under 18 years old are allowed to go. Discos are held on other nights for adults. At the disco popular records are played and coloured lights flash. Sometimes there are competitions for the best dancers. The winners usually get a record as a prize. If you get hot whilst dancing you can buy a soft drink and sit at a table to rest. If you do not want to dance you can just listen to the music or play pool or play on one of the video games machines. To enter the disco it costs 50 pence.
